user.biography:
Inspiration for play & learning
👧🏻 Mama of 3, Former EY teacher
🛒Designer of the PlayTRAY™👇
@inspiremyplaystore 
🛒 Playful Printables subscription👇

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Laura | Inspire My Play ® on September 16, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, food and indoor.

node.text:
SCOOP AND FILL AUTUMN LEAVES
.
A little autumn/fall themed scoop and fill activity that’s great for fine motor skills 🍁🍂
.
Rice makes a great sensory base and is always a winner alongside containers and scoops.
.
You can easily colour rice with food colouring or a squirt of paint. Head to my reels for a ‘how to’ video or there’s a link in my bio to a blog post.
.
To make the leaves I cut a toilet roll into strips and pinched one side to form a leaf shape 🍂
.
I then placed them around a branch that we picked up on a walk.
.
I like that this activity is easy to repeat. Just remove the leaves and branch and pour the rice back into a bowl before starting again. 🍁 🍂 🍃 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#fallactivities #autumnplay #inspiremyplay #recycleandplay #learningthroughplay #playideas #playathome #letthemplay #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning #homeschoolpreschool
#preschoolactivity #preschoolathome #eyfs #eyfsideas 
#sensoryplay 
#finemotorskills #finemotoractivities #earlylearning101 #activitiesforkids #earlychildhoodeducation #kidsatplay #funforkids

node.text:
TINFOIL & KITCHEN TOWEL OWLS
.
We are big fans of this technique of modelling out of tinfoil. It’s quicker and less messy than paper mache. And with the decoupaged kitchen towel over the top it makes the finished figures really robust so they can have fun playing with them afterwards 🤗
.
To make these cute owls you will need:
.
*Tin-foil
*Kitchen towel
*Paint
*PVA glue
*Card
*Googly eyes
.
Method:
.
1. Paint pieces of kitchen towel with slightly watered down ready mix paint- you want it to soak through to the other side. These will make the feathers.
.
2. Whilst the kitchen towel is drying scrunch up some tinfoil into a ball/ owl body shape.
.
3. Once the kitchen towel is dry, tear it up into little pieces and stick them onto the tinfoil using pva glue. This is similar to decoupage. Once the foil is hidden you can add a few extra feathers with just the top end glued down to make it look like the owl’s wings.
.
To finish off your owl glue on googly eyes and and make card feet and a beak.
.
Swipe through the photos for all of the steps. Any questions- please do post them in the comments 😊 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#craftykids #artycraftykids #creativeplay #inspiremyplay #preschoolactivities #eyfs #learningathome #learningthroughplay #invitationtocreate #earlylearning #earlyyears #kidsactivities #homeschooling #playingathome #earlyyears #earlylearning #earlylearning101 #autumnplay #fallplayactivities

node.text:
WINDOW LEAF PRINTING 🍁 🍃🍂
.
A little throwback to our window leaf printing activity.
.
Leaf printing is such a classic activity and easily accessible for different ages. We also love doing this on paper but we thought we’d switch it up by doing a bit of a collaborative effort on the window.
.
We used paint sticks for this- they’re a low mess alternative to painting and work really well on glass or a mirror. They worked especially well for leaf printing! For anyone wondering...it comes off easily with a bit of glass cleaner 👍
.
Leaf printing works best when the leaves are fresh. Paint on the side with the veins before printing. Then peel off carefully.
.
Paint sticks are from @littlebrianpaintsticks. You can find them in my Amazon storefront (link in bio).
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#learningthroughplay #playideas #playathome #simpleactivities #inspiremyplay #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning #homeschoolpreschool 
#preschoolplay 
#preschoolactivity #toddleractivities #eyfs #eyfsideas
#finemotorskills #finemotoractivities #creativeplay #messyplay #playtolearn #earlylearning101 #handsonlearning #autumnplay #activitiesforkids #earlychildhoodeducation #kidsatplay #funforkids

node.text:
AUTUMN/FALL NATURE BRUSHES & PRINTING
.
This was some fun process art that uses up all those autumn treasures that kids like to collect!
.
To make the nature brushes I attached the nature bits to the top of sticks using some elastic bands. We also used some autumn objects to print with and roll around the paper.
.
Lots of lovely exploration and messy fun! 🍁 🍂 🍃 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#inspiremyplay #autumnplay #fallplay #learningathome #playathome #learningthroughplay #autumnplayideas #playmatters #finemotorskills #processart #kidslearning #funforkids #letthemplay #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning #homeschool #homeeducation 
#eyfs #eyfsideas 
#playtolearn #earlychildhoodeducation #natureplay #1000hoursoutside #preschoolplay

node.text:
FALL LEAF PICTURES
.
This is such a simple activity...perfect for autumn/fall!
.
We used a white acrylic paint pen to draw our leaf designs but paint sticks also work quite well or a white crayon.
.
If your little ones might struggle to draw their own leaves you could always put some leaf outlines underneath the kitchen towel to trace!
.
For more simple crafts & play ideas follow us @inspiremyplay. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#fallplayactivities #autumnactivities #kidsatplay #inspiremyplay #playmatters #simpleplay #learnthroughplaying #artycraftykids #artactivities #preschoolplay #playingathome #inspiremyplaytray

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Laura | Inspire My Play ® on September 07, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text:
PLANTING & HARVESTING
..
This is the perfect time of year for a harvesting activity! We had our mini vegetables out today that we made using air-dry clay and Miss 3 had fun planting them into a tray of cloud dough before harvesting them! You can also do this in the PlayTRAY compartments (swipe to see).
.
If you’re new to air-dry clay, it is a coloured, soft and foamy clay and so easy for little hands to manipulate. 👌There are lots of people selling it on Amazon these days but be sure you’re not buying polymer clay as that’s a bit different (more like fimo) and not so easy to manipulate for the little ones. I’ve got the set we always buy listed in my Amazon storefront if you want to take a look (link in bio). 
.
For the base of this tray I used cocoa-coloured cloud dough. This works so well for ‘planting’ as it holds the veggies in place.
.
To make this cloud dough simply mix up:
1 cup of cocoa powder
3 cups of flour 
1/2 cup of oil.
.
If you store it in an airtight container it should keep for several months.
.
More info on the PlayTRAY via our bio or @inspiremyplay. We’re low shipping in the U.K, US and Europe plus lots of other destinations worldwide.🎉
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#learningthroughplay #playideas #playathome #letthemplay #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning #homeschool #homeeducation
#preschoolplay 
#preschoolactivity #preschoolathome #eyfs #eyfsathome #eyfsideas

node.text:
LEAF ART
.
This is a great way to use up those endless leaves the kids like to pick up! 
.
Leaf art works best on fresh leaves, before they become too brittle. We used paintsticks to decorate some and acrylic paint pens to add details.
.
You can preserve leaves pretty well using a laminator but if you want to do this just stick to acrylic paint pens as they hold up best. 🍁 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#artycraftykids #artykids 
 #learningthroughplay #playideas #playathome #letthemplay #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning #homeschool #homeschoolpreschool #playingathome
#preschoolactivity #preschoolathome #eyfs #eyfsteacher #eyfsideas

node.text:
LEAF IDENTIFICATION PEBBLES
.
We’re feeling super excited to start the autumn/fall play soon! Awhile back we made these leaf pebbles as a handy resource to identify the many leaves we pick up on walks! They’re also lots of fun to make! 🍂 
.
Here’s how to make some yourself:
.
What You Will Need:
.
•Large pebbles
•Small leaves
•Mod Podge
•Flower press or microwave
.
How to:
.
1. The first step is to press the leaves. This can be done in a flower press or for a shortcut method use a microwave!
.
2. To use a microwave put the leaves between two pieces of kitchen towel and then between two dinner plates, with a cup of water in the microwave too and heat for 20-30 seconds. The cup of water is really important to ensure the leaves don’t catch fire so don’t forget it!
.
3. Cover the pebbles with a layer of Mod Podge and then stick the leaves to them.
.
4. Cover the leaf and pebble with a second layer of Mod Podge paying special attention to the corners of the leaf to make sure they are stuck down well. An adult might need to do this bit.
.
5. Once everything is dry you can write the name of the leaf on the back of the pebble using a permanent marker or acrylic paint pen. 🍂 🍃 🍁 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#learningthroughplay #playideas #playingathome #playathome #letthemplay #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning #homeschool #homeschoolpreschool #homeeducation #playathomemum
#preschoolplay #eyfs #eyfsteacher #eyfsideas #teachermum 
#diymum #150hoursoutside

node.text:
Congratulations to our winners! 
@baby_mlow
@the_mummy_teacher &
@rizitaj 
.
CONNETIX WORLDWIDE GIVEAWAY
.
We’re celebrating 300K by giving away 3 sets of our favourite magnetic tiles from @connetix_tiles!
.
3 lucky people will win @connetix_tiles’ NEW 120 creative set in the most stunning range of pastel colours 😍 🌈 
.
To be in with a chance of winning you need to:
.
1) Make sure you follow both @connetix_tiles AND @inspiremyplay
2) LIKE and SAVE this post
3) Tag as many friends as you like in comments below. Each tag in separate comments is a new entry.
4) For a bonus entry, share in your stories. Don’t forget to tag us so we can count your entry.
.
And that’s it!
.
This giveaway is open now and closes on Friday 3rd September at 8pm BST.
.
Open WORLDWIDE to anyone over 18 years-old. This giveaway is in no way endorsed or linked to Instagram.
.
Winners will be announced within 48 hours and prizes will be delivered when they are in stock in your region.
.
Please note the winners will be announced on this post. Please do not give out your details to anyone claiming you have won without checking on here first.
.
Photo credit-@x_macy_and_ollie_x 

.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
JELLY LETTER DIG
.
I love thinking up playful ways to practice letters! This was an instant hit with mine and I love the way it can be adapted for different stages/needs.
.
There’s a couple of activities shown here but you can also extend this to match letters to pictures with the same initial sound or to practice word building- this could be a missing sound in a word or building up the whole cvc word by retrieving all the letters out of the jelly.
.
We used gelatine powder and a bit of food colouring. It’s an easy way to make lots of different colours. The PlayTRAY segments are perfect for this as the gelatine sets really well whereas I have made a whole tray before which takes a lot of time and gelatine to set! They’re also much easier to stack in the fridge!
.
I’ll be putting these alphabet sheets up on our Playful Printables member pages incase you want to download them. And as always you can purchase the PlayTRAY on our website in U.K. & the US (www.inspiremyplaystore.com). 
.
For our EU customers we’ve just found we can send it to most places via our Amazon U.K. listing. This was a complete surprise to us but appears to be working well. I’ve already had some lovely messages from people telling me their PlayTRAY has arrived and with no customs bill! 🎉 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
MATH WITH LOOSE PARTS
.
Here are some different ways we used loose parts to explore mathematical concepts. We were practising number recognition, 1-1 correspondence (careful counting) and also sharing equally (butterfly wing activity).
.
Each activity used some cardboard discs that I made with numbers 1-10 written on one side and 11-20 on the other and then I used a dry wipe pen for the rest- quick and easy 👌
.
We used our @joguines_grapat mandala pieces which we absolutely love but you could also use any loose parts for these activities- pebbles, buttons, pom-poms, petals, leaves... whatever you can lay your hands on!
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#inspiremyplay #onehundredtoys #grapat #grapatmandala #woodentoys #looseparts #loosepartsplay #learningthroughplay #playtolearn #playactivities #mathsactivities #mathsplay #earlyyears #learningathome #playathome #playmatters #homeschool #mathactivities

node.text:
FELT BALL/POM-POM RESCUE
.
This takes just a few minutes to set up but is such a great work out for little hands!
.
The idea is to pick up the felt balls through the gaps in the elastic bands. We used the PlayTRAY lid to hold our felt balls but any shallow container would work well.
.
The squeezy tweezers from @learningresourcesuk are perfect for this but regular tweezers are great too.
.
You can do all sorts of things to extend this activity- sort the balls into colours, count the balls into each pot, sort by size etc...
.
Using giant elastic bands makes this activity so easy to set up but as an alternative you can wrap your tray in some masking tape or washi-tape.
.
PlayTRAY is available to buy from our website: www.inspiremyplaystore.com @inspiremyplaystore 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
